Transcription for 547089

The Lord's my shepherd, I'll not want.
He makes me down to lie, In pasture's green,
He leadeth me, The quiet waters by.
My soul, the earth, restore again, And be to walk the plain.
Within the vows of my just guess, He for His own may stay.
Behold, I walk through hell's dark veil, Death will I feel, not yield.
For the Lord with me and my God, Has set me calm for still.
My day or love has perished yet, In presence of my foes.
My death, the cross, with all the noise, And my powerful will falls.
Goodness and mercy of my life Shall surely follow me.
And in the sounds forevermore, My dwelling place shall be.
